sn56.131:3.1: 131 Dying as Ghosts and Reborn as Ghosts
sn56.131:4.1: “… the sentient beings who die as ghosts and are reborn as gods are few,
sn56.131:4.2: while those who die as ghosts and are reborn in the ghost realm are many.
sn56.131:4.4: It’s because they haven’t seen the four noble truths.
sn56.131:4.6: The noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.131:5.1: That’s why you should practice meditation to understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.”
sn56.131:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn56.131:6.2: Uplifted, the mendicants approved of what the Buddha said.
sn56.131:10.1: The Linked Discourses on the Truths, the twelfth section.
